intro: Desmoncus hartii, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30 cm. The plant features bright yellow flowers with a distinctive cup-shaped structure, which is characteristic of the Ranunculaceae family. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a rough texture. Desmoncus hartii thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and disturbed areas.
